Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, property, very family friendly”
Reviews.Author: tntpdx
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms on the newer side. Comfy beds and decent bed and bath linens. We had a two bedroom, two bath suite with a small living area and full, if somewhat tiny kitchen. The hotel grounds are very good; we used the pool and the spa tub which were both kept up well with pool towels and lots of comfortable chairs and tables. The hot breakfast was great with slightly different selections every day and the attendant Frank took good care of everybody, even our little kiddies! All the staff, front desk, housekeeping, facilities were friendly and professional and service was always very prompt. The hotel is walking distance to lots of restaurants, grocery stores and shopping (Marshall's, Ross) and there is also a golf course nearby. Parking is free. I have just a few complaints/suggestions: There is not wifi throughout the complex. In our room (on the ground floor) there was only one wired internet connection. We inquired about getting another cable, but learned the room had only one port, so we were unable to both work on our computers at the same time. (There is wireless in the lobby.) There were no luggage racks in either bedroom so you have to leave your bag on the floor of the closet or room or unpack if you don't want to have to squat everytime you want to get at your stuff. My bathroom had only a shower and it was *tiny* and had only a soap dish; no where to put shampoo, razor, etc. The other bathroom was better with a full tub. We liked the Residence Inn, Carmel Mountain Ranch and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: luvabulldog
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, little gem of a hotel with spacious, clean, comfy rooms. We've been treated like valued guests thru the entire stay. Our 2nd floor room looks out over the pool and hillsides of San Diego. Despite being conveniently close to highway 15, it's quiet and calm. The heated pool is very well maintained and offers a lovely place to sun. The firepit next to it is so comfy and enjoyable. I can't say enough good about the management and housekeeping. And the breakfasts and evening snacks are delightful. We travel about 200 days a year, and this hotel is the best we've stayed at EVER. To say we highly recommend it is an understatement. The hotel is delightful...but it's the staff that makes it a great place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Family Friendly Stay”
Reviews.Author: NatalieF101
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The suite was wonderful and luxurious. From the photographs it seems there is varying quality to the suites, so I would stipulate 'newly renovated' The breakfast was good and evening snack time a wonderful addition to the value of our stay. My daughter loved the pool and so nice to have to fill the time between coming back from a day out of exploring San Diego and bath and bed time for her. Our experience was very positive. The only thing worthwhile to mention is the property's proximity to attractions since it is not 'centrally' located - what ever that means for San Diego - I have nothing else to compare it with. I would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience & room”
Reviews.Author: Anntoinette
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to celebrate christmas with our relatives down the road, and were very happy we did! Our room - it was more a one bedroom apt- was really cute. There was a full size refrigerator with a WORKING ice maker (bliss!), a two burner stove, microwave, and even complimentary coffee, tea and popcorn. Cupboards had everything needed for a meal, pans, utensial, wine opener, wine glasses, etc. Bath was nice. One door from the living area and another from the bedroom. Bed linens were really nice, though the bed was a bit soft. Pool area looked nice, but it wasn't pool weather. They were painting all the buildings, and warned us on one day that there might be painters outside in the afternoon, so to close the drapes. Breakfast was nice...the DIY belgian waffles were wonderful! Front desk people were friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Residence Inn Nationwide!”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay overall! I highly recommend this hotel over many residence inns stateside. The hospitality was second to none and extremely accommodating. Happy hour 3 nights per week was superb with chilled wine, beer and great selection of side foods.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit. The morning breakfast was quite crowded but the tables were always cleaned quickly and there seemed to be plenty of food. I commend the woman who was working to make sure we all had all that we wanted!! Your check in and check out staff were attentive. The rooms were clean and well stocked. Your hotel certainly met the standard of Marriott. We will continue to choose Marriott. Mary and Michael Simmons -

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amber907
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at this Residence Inn with my husband, mother-in-law, and 2 kids. All of us were impressed with the property and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!The 2 BR suite was a great value and fit our needs just rightâ€¦..husband & I in one room, mother-in-law in the other and the 2 kids on the pull-out queen sleeper sofa in the living room. Each bedroom had its own bathroom which was really convenient! This was cheaper for us than getting 2 separate regular rooms at another hotel (comparable to to a similar safe, clean hotel, that is!) and also cheaper than staying in a 1 BR suite at any other suites properties that I researched. The room was beautifully decorated, very modern, and very clean. The kitchen almost looked as if it had never even been cooked in! Very nice full-size fridge, stove and dishwasher......the kitchen itself is a little small, as are all the rooms, but because of the layout, we did not feel crowded at all! The rest of the facility was really nice too, especially the recreation area. We enjoyed being able to eat our breakfast out on the patio under an umbrella-table (they have a really nice indoor eating area as well)......and the breakfast was very nice! Lots of variety......better than most hotel buffets I have had! Also, we were not there to take advantage, but saw that they have complimentary dinner-time meals Monday through Wednesday, and the menu hanging on our fridge looked pretty yummy, including a BBQ on Wednesdays. We only wished we could've stayed longer! They had lots of amenities for familiy activities, such as a ping-pong table, basketball/tennis court, pool & jacuzzi (pool was a nice depth for kids.....shallow on the ends and just slightly deeper in the middle). There was also a dog park, and a really nice outdoor sitting area with a pretty fountain and comfortable, cushioned chairs. Also wanted to mention that the hotel is in an excellent location.....just off the 15 freeway in a beautiful residential area.....great restaurants nearby; we walked to an Olive Garden and had a delicious dinner. We were exactly halfway between the San Diego Zoo and the Wild Animal Park (Safari Park), which is what we were on vacation to do (20 minutes from each park). Parking was safe & free, and wifi was free too (There was a hook-up cable in the room, but I was also able to pull up an open wifi connection on my smart phone). Given the opportunity, we would definitely return to this hotel again! My husband said that this experience really made him a Residence Inn fan.....I replied that I am already a Marriott fan too.....they have impressed me again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay, will be back here again soon”
Reviews.Author: nicsmom1
Reviews.Content: The staff here was very nice and helpful. The room was very clean, location is great. There are a number of restaurants, stores and such very close by, walking distance even. Loved that it was out of the way a little bit so you aren't in the middle of all the crowds you find in hotel circle area. Would recommend this to anyone traveling to San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent residence - clean - good for kids”
Reviews.Author: Francesco R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn last week (we had to leave our Townhouse for fumigation). We spent 3 days and i would reccommend this to anyone who likes to stay in an hotel with all the accessories you will have in your house (dishwasher-washer/dryer - microwave ...etc..etc.. I am very pleased for the quality of the equipment I found in the room (not the usual cheap stuff). Very Clean and excellent for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Loved and will definitely recommend to out of town guests!”
Reviews.Author: Zin63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while having some work done at our house. Friendly and very helpful staff. Rooms were very clean. Appliances seemed very new and clean as well. Could not hear neighbors. Even though our room was close to highway, no noise was heard with the doors closed and air on. Complimentary hot breakfasts with Manager's social on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday which included a hot meal and drinks was included in fee. No parking charge. Convenient location and close to grocery stores, cinemas, shopping etc. Kids had a pool to swim in, tennis court to play on and also a ping pong table. The pool was not heated but worked great considering the 90's temps outdoors. Staff was very helpful and reception/front lobby very friendly! Would definitely stay again and will recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gr1069
Reviews.Content: We had an unexpected stay due to a medical issue and booked last minute. The staff helped us with our need for a room downstairs without much walking. I called in as we needed a bunch of pillows in the room. They were quick to help. I appreciated the level of service they provided. Plenty of restaurants and shopping in the area. Not sure why they don't have king sized beds. I guess the room is too small

Reviews.Title: “Great experience during a busy week!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon F
Reviews.Content: Clean & comfortable with friendly/helpful staff. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of a variety of restaurants. The breakfast buffet was a pleasant surprise, as you never know what you're going to get with these. We stayed during a busy week when the hotel was filled with hungry young athletes and their families, my own included. The staff kept the breakfast food coming every morning until everyone was fed. There was a nice variety - always scrambled eggs, but also nice potato wedges or potato pancakes, different sausage options along with yogurt, waffles, cereals and break selections. When they said breakfast was available until 9:30 they kept everything supplied until then, not what I have experienced at other places where they let stop bringing food out 1/2 hour before they stop the buffet. It's a great place for families. It felt safe, and has outdoor ping pong, a pool, jacuzzi, sport court and pleasant outside sitting area/barbeque set-up. If ever in the area we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: udad8
Reviews.Content: I am extremely appreciative of the highly professional and outstanding service I receive each time I stay at this Residence Inn. As a businessman I have the opportunity to stay at a number of facilities but I continually choose this site. I am treated with upmost respect and all the employees work hard to assure a home-style atmosphere that is relaxing and supportive to the business traveler. A special thanks to Casey, Hentel and Kelley who continually go the extra mile to assure that I have a excellent experience. Thank you also to the entire staff who and extremely supportive and helpfu. I have been staying here for 5 years and will stay nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable experience not to be dismissed.”
Reviews.Author: dalekana
Reviews.Content: From the time I checked in, I knew this would be a special place to stay. Being on business travel, I have stayed at many hotels, but this one was different. This is the only Residence Inn that I know of that serves locally brewed beer at happy hour. An excellent one at that. The hotel staff is helpful and friendly. Rooms are nicely presented and clean. And quiet, even though it's located almost next to the freeway. Just a walk away is all the shopping and dining at your leisure. My only gripe is that at check out, I have to go get my receipt instead of having it hanging on the door. I guess it may be a security thing. At any rate, if you're in the area check this place out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KerriBCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay. The rooms were just redone and are very clean as is the grounds. The pool was nice and warm which my son (age 10) enjoyed very much. The free breakfast was also a nice amenity - there were several things to choose from. The bedroom part of the room was quite small but offered everything you need in a hotel room. This hotel was a great value and the customer service was excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recently Updated, Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: PromoRoadGuy
Reviews.Content: Many of the reviews below mention that this property was old and worn down. Just wanted to update that they've renovated at least several rooms and I assume eventually all of them. The interior is as nice as I've experienced at a Residence Inn. Granite counter tops, stainless steel fridge, upgraded stove top, flat screens in two rooms. Upgraded and very satisfactory workout facilities. Based on my one night here, I don't know if they've fixed the sound issue though. I'm in a room that has an adjoining room, and even though the people next door are speaking at reasonable volumes I can pretty much hear them like they're in my living room. So, awesome rooms, just hope that you get a quiet neighbor.

Reviews.Title: “Maggots, Moldy Food, and Grubs Oh My!”
Reviews.Author: Niecer1079
Reviews.Content: To start, like others have mentioned this is an older type Residence Inn and was not in any way worth the points that we used to pay for our stay here. We are on our second of five nights here and if there was an option to check out...I would! We are planning on calling the Gold Line tomorrow to complain. When my husband and I went to use the microwave to heat up a meal for dinner we discovered that the cleaning crew had not cleaned the microwave in days. The contents were a plate of moldy maggot infested carne asada tacos. My husband took them to the front desk. The front desk attendant contacted her Customer Service Manager, Hetal [--], and then came to clean the microwave. We were not moved because my husbands parents were staying in the next room to ours and they did not want to seperate us. In the morning my husband followed up with the General Manager, Casey [--], who apologized and treated my husband with little to no regard. We came back to the hotel room after a long day of exploring San Diego to find a large grub crawling around on the bathroom floor. My husband contacted the front desk again and advised them of our discovery...again we recieved an apology. Apparantly this property is so accustomed to apologizing for their lack of care or customer service that "I am sorry" rolls off their tongue with a complete lack of sincerity. Take your money elsewhere! My husband travels a great deal for work and spends 2-3 nights a week in hotels and holds elite membership status with Marriott, SPG, Priority Club, and Hilton Honors. By far this is a most disgusting experience with a complete disregard to customer care and complete lack of respect for a Marriott Rewards member.

Reviews.Title: “2-star, comfortable, but dated”
Reviews.Author: Schneidler
Reviews.Content: A convenient place off the I-15 at exit 21, south of a large shopping center. Several wineries are nearby, in the Escondido area. If you have a discounted rate, this place is good value. Our room is well-kept; kitchen is very usable with good appliances. Size is a bit small, about 360 sq. ft., single sink in the bath. TV is a CRT, only viewable from the sofa, not in bed. Internet connection may be problematic: no in-room wireless, the wired connection is nonfunctional in our room. You may get residual signal if your room is near the meeting room, which is equipped with a wireless access point. Tried using "Hotel Services" from the on-screen menu, but it did not work. Could not review bill or do in-room check-out. Breakfast is buffet-style with eggs, cereals, fruits, pastries, among others, but the offerings are visibly trimmed down and budget-minded. What this Residence Inn lacks in amenities, it makes up on the human side. The front-desk staff is courteous and competent. Our reservation requests for extra towels and pillows, high floor, and early check-in: all are accommodated. As a two-star hotel, to be fair, it hits the mark. But if you want something nicer, there is a newer Residence Inn (and a Springhill Suites) only two exits south on the I-15.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: LaughterHappens
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect when I arrived in San Diego for the first time. The hotel was in a beautiful location/great neighborhood. It was close to the freeway, but nestled in its little area. Very close to restaurants, ice cream shop, gas station. I enjoyed my stay very much. My room was next to the gym which I utilized while I was there. I was able to print my boarding passes at no cost downstairs. Breakfast was just ok, but there was free breakfast, nonetheless, and free is always good :) As was the high speed internet and parking. Was able to walk around the corner for a bottle of wine at BevMo and up the way for a late night fish taco at Sombreros. The walls were a little thin, but my floor just above the lobby was fairly quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I definitely want to take my family next time next time around!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but don't pay more than $100 a night”
Reviews.Author: sophie832
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Residence Inn from Sept. 25-27, 2009. From the get go, I had an issue because I'd somehow mistakenly booked a room at the Courtyard Rancho Bernardo instead of the Residence Inn. Since I booked only a couple of days before we left, I didn't notice the problem until we were already at the Courtyard. The woman at the front desk there was thoroughly unhelpful as far as contacting the Residence Inn for me (they are both Marriott hotels, right???). Anyway, once I got Marriott reservations on the phone, they told me the rate for the Residence Inn was $108/night, while my rate for the Courtyard had been $87/night. This was a bit upsetting, but I thought of it in terms of free breakfast and a kitchen, and decided to change my reservation. Luckily, you can cancel without penalty until 6pm on the day of check-in. I think we happened to be at the Residence Inn on a fairly quiet weekend for the hotel. We had no trouble parking the entire time we were there (including one night when we came back at midnight), and we were in Building 2, which is right near the main building and the pool area. Our room was 1 queen bed and sofabed. French doors separated the bedroom from the living room, and bathroom had doors to both the bedroom and the kitchen. The kitchen was small, but perfect for the two of us. The only issue we had with the room was that the TV was outdated and not visible from the bed. An argument could be made as to not needing TV in the bedroom, but I think most people are used to being able to watch TV from bed if necessary. It was in front of the sofabed, though, so that's something. The sofabed mattress was stained, so we never used it (didn't need it anyway). The room also had a small balcony which overlooked the parking lot. I never used the fitness room, but it looked adequate. Breakfast was good each morning. The hot dish the first morning was make-your-own breakfast burrito. The second morning, it was biscuits and sausage gravy. You could also make your own waffles. My husband brought breakfast up to the room the second morning, and they provided him a tray and said just to leave the dishes in the room. Housekeeping, btw, was excellent. I can see how walking to breakfast from the other, further away buildings could be a chore. I would recommend requesting a room closer to the main lobby building. We used the pool on the second day. We had the place entirely to ourselves. The only problem was the lack of shade, and the wasps. Live wasps kept flying into the pool and floating in there. Also, the lounge chairs were dirty, and there wasn't a lot of shade. We didn't use the jacuzzi because we'd noticed painters near it the day before, and the residue from their paint might've gotten into the water. The location of the hotel is excellent for the Wild Animal Park (only a few miles down the 15 fwy). Also, it is near a HUGE outdoor shopping and dining area. We literally had every store or restaurant we could ever need within walking distance (up and down some hills, though). There is also a gas station/car wash right by the hotel parking lot, and a few restaurants and stores right next door. The staff was friendly, check-in and check-out were a breeze. My biggest issue was merely the price vs. the quality. Overall, we would stay here again, but at a lower rate.

Reviews.Title: “Older than the typical Residence Inn.”
Reviews.Author: BearAndPenguin
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn wasn't bad, but it wasn't up to par with the other Residence Inns that I have stayed at. The building was older and was poorly designed. The buildings are in pods and share one elevator which is a little annoying. The inside of the room was nice enough but the kitchen showed its age a little. Overall, it was fine for the money but could have been nicer. The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Older-Style Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: PageantGuru
Reviews.Content: The most irritating thing about this hotel is the overbilling (which I have never experienced at a Marriott Hotel). (I am a Platinum Elite member.) I am staying for an extended period. Like all Marriotts, they said they would be billing when the account reached $1000. They have been doing that, but they have also been adding other unwarranted charges every day. $370, $270, $110, etc. Have to check my bank account and go by the front desk concerning this every single day. Always get an answer that they don't know why the "other person" added the charges, and they would take them off and not do it again. But every day it happens again. Looking for a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “where to stay if your house burns down”
Reviews.Author: spyaction
Reviews.Content: We were in "hotel" captivity here for 54 days following the witch creek fire in October 2007. Very passive aggressive hotel, if you asked a question about billing, you would get a series of reminder calls asking you to extend your stay... at 2 AM!! If that didn't get you, they would double your rate, saying high inflex of guests, (even if you had the same rate for 1 month), but would send you a gift basket. Lots of out side noise too. The kitchen staff was very very nice and helpful. They provided a pretty good breakfast and allowed pets to stay, which was a BIG plus. Next time the house goes up in flames, think we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, very comfortable beds. Not the quietest.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFromSanJose
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 days. It was good, but did not quite meet our admittingly high expectations based on previous visits in other residence inn hotels. The property is a little bit dated, but clean. The breakfirst area is small and tends to get crowded. The food is good and the staff is very friendly. When we checked in the room we were originally given faced the pool and basketball court, with kids playing literally right outside of our bedroom window. The staff was very helpful to switch rooms right away to something facing to the street, which turned out to be the right choice. That night the courtyward area stayed busy and loud at least until 10 PM. All in all an OK experience, but next time I would go with the nearby Residence in Poway/Scripps, which is much newer and a little lower priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad but lacking attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily714612
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, tucked into a location near the freeway. The rooms are fine. Nice living space with a kitchen (no oven), a pocket door to separate the living space from the bedroom, and an OK sized bath. The staff are friendly and helpful. The downsides are: the common dining area where breakfast (so-so) is served is small. Most often a table is not available. Also, parking is scarce. Housekeeping is negligent in many ways. Failing to leave towels, toilet paper, and the like. The worst are the dirty laundry and the pet policy. There are howling dogs throughout the property and the room I stayed in smelled doggy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Cycleboy
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, the staff was great the front desk was very accomodating to my room change request. Rooms were very clean and the facility was well maintained. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: kevgy
Reviews.Content: Comfortable appartment with more facilities than I use. Spacious site, not a horrible tower block. Eating and bars within reasonable walking distance. Good breakfast range but not much fresh fruit, some days only apples. Wish they would put tea bags in the rooms but you can get them from the breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Real Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: mygirlkimmy
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Friendly front desk, the room was nice and clean and the location is very close to shopping and restaurants. Easy access to the freeway system. Would definitely stay here again, and will always stay in a Residence Inn if at all possible - they are great. Mrs. R, Omaha, NE

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small and walls are thin”
Reviews.Author: Wise_One
Reviews.Content: Personally, I prefer the older style Residence Inn. For business I typically stay at Marriott properties. This location while newer and nice,I could hear conversations and the person snoring in the room next to me. Maybe I just don't like this style of Residence Inn. Breakfast was great, bed was comfy, interent connectivity had no problem and location was pretty good. For price I decided to stay elsewhere for following week.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ELD702
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5yr old son and 3 yr old daughter stayed here over the Labor Day weekend for 3 nights. I booked through arestravel.com which allowed me to pay only a deposit of $15 up front - the rest was billed to me at the end of our stay. I booked a one room suite. We arrived late on a Friday night - we stayed in Building 6 - I had read the previous review about the higher the building number the closer you are to the freeway (and the noise) and I was happy - I could definitely hear the freeway, but it wasnt enough to keep me awake at night, although I assume if you are in Bldg 10 you would definitely run into this problem. The hotel is convenient enough to the I-15 freeway (it is right off the freeway) and is in the middle of a great shopping area - you can walk to the Olive Garden, Carls Jr., Subway, Chevron, etc. and is literally a 2minute drive to the Calif.Pizza Kitchen, Chevy's, Marie Callendars, Jamba Juice, Starbucks, etc. There is also a Ralphs Supermarket and Rite Aid right around the corner...VERY convenient. I loved the location! The room itself was kept very clean by housekeeping and I found nothing that I could complain about. Also, FREE high speed internet connection in the rooms! At the main office you can use their computer in their business center if you need to print out boarding passes, admission tickets, etc. I used it to print out our Sea World tickets - they charge your room $.10 for every page you have printed. The pull out sofa bed in the room was adequate - my kids brought their own bedding for the sofa bed, which was totally my preference, there were sheets for the sofa bed and extra pillows provided. My only complaint (which had nothing to do with the hotel) was the mosquitos - they were everywhere! I was going to ask to switch rooms as I thought it was a room problem, but my husband found a mosquito swatter in the closet and we guessed that this was a San Diego problem and not a room problem. I may be wrong, but we didnt let the mosquitos ruin our vacation! The morning breakfasts were great, but take everyone else's advice and get there early as tables fill up fast. There was a party of six that came to breakfast every morning and then leisurely sat at the tables chit-chatting while people waited for tables to sit at. Nothing wrong with that but common courtesy I guess would be to continue conversation elsewhere where the seating is not so limiting --- literally maybe 6-7 tables to sit at. The breakfast buffet always had dry cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, doughnuts and pastries, toast, bagels, fruit, scrambled eggs and fried potatoes. They alternated the hot entree offerings by serving hot croissants, french toast, pancakes the first day; french toast, biscuits & gravy the second day; and sausage patties and tortillas the third day, along with a rice-cooker filled with steamed rice. There is also a waffle maker available all days, but it only makes one belgian waffle at a time. I would definitely stay here again -- driving to the San Diego Zoo took maybe 20minutes and the same time when driving to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: YOGAMOMMAs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Residence Inn July 26th-30th. I was a little disappointed at the size of the room, compared to another Residence we had stayed previously a couple of years ago. BUT... the bedding was very nice. New, clean and comfortable. I can say it's the best hotel bed I have ever slept on. The first night we stayed, I was awoke from 11:30 to 2:30 in the morning, by VERY loud construction on the nearby freeway. The next day I tried to change rooms, but the hotel was booked. The front desk staff was very friendly and tried to help, but not a lot they could do, except offter ear plugs. Same thing the following night, but used the ear plugs. Didn't have any more problems following that night. But I did learn a good lesson. Call ahead to see if there is any construction near by, and it wouldn't have been a problem except our building was near the freeway. If you book here, try to get a building closer to the main area. We were in building 8. They have 1 through 10 buildings and the closer to 10 the closer you are to the freeway. The FREE breakfast in the morning was very good. Cereal, oatmeal, bagels, toast, eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, donuts, coffee, juices, soft drinks. The eating area is a bit small though and had to wait each morning to find a spot to eat with a family of 5. Oh, and they had a FREE dinner, snack at night Monday through Thursday, which also was very good. The front desk was able to print directions to areas of interest, which was convienient. The pool was pretty nice, not big, but clean. Overall a very nice, clean, quiet hotel. Took about 15 minutes to Seaworld and about the same to La Jolla beach

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling clean, quiet, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: OakForest_ILMary
Reviews.Content: I am so sorry we were only able to stay 3 days. The location was perfect for us, the room was spotless, quiet, spacious and far exceeded our expectations. The price was great, too. The breakfast provided in the lobby was excellent, not just a continental breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn after my best friend's wedding. The wedding location was beautiful, every little detail was taken care of, and the staff was amazing. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: RichmondVA
Reviews.Content: I just returned to VA from a 5-day trip to San Diego (my hometown)!! My fiance' and I had the opportunity to stay at the Residence Inn in Rancho Bernardo. We had the best time!! We were greeted at the front desk by the nicest hotel clerk, and felt like 'family' from day-1. We checked in on a Thursday around 7:45pm, and just missed 'happy hour' which is a variety of food served from 4:30pm-7:30pm, Mon-Thurs. We were told that they offer a full breakfast buffet daily, so we decided to check it out. It was great! Depending on the day, you can choose from French toast, pancakes, tacos, or biscuits & gravy, AND, donuts, fruit, cereals, muffins, bagels, toast, scrambled eggs, seasoned potatoes, sausage, yogurt, coffee, tea or milk. We ate by the pool one day, and in our room on another. The room, had a full kitchen (complete with utensils, plates/cups, pots/pans), private balcony, central air/heat, and free internet access. We felt as if we had found the perfect 'apartment'. If you want to visit San Diego and experience a nice, quiet, upscale setting, then the Residence Inn in Rancho Bernardo is for you. The staff was always friendly, and helpful. They offer to pick-up groceries, provide 24 gym privileges, and the use of a clothing valet service. We have both decided to make this 'our' special place when we visit in the future. Dee in Richmond, VA

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn San Diego Rancho Bernardo / Carmel Mountain Ranch
HotelInfo.Address: 11002 Rancho Carmel Drive, San Diego, CA 92128
